member.name: T:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.Transforms
member.summary:
Transforms is a collection of 4x4 matricies. These matricies can be formed by using DHMatrix or RussMatrix or whatever method you prefer.
Calling DotProduct(), returns the dot product of all the matricies in this system in the order they were added to the collection.
This Class also has a CrossProduct(double[] a, double[] b) method. This returns a x b and is unrelated to the collection of matricies.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.Transforms.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.Transforms.CrossProduct(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Cross Product is unrelated to the collection of matricies in this class and merely returns the i, j, k scalers of the a x b function.
member.param: a one dimensional double array of three elements. a[0] = i scaler a[1] = j scaler a[2] = k scaler
member.returns: a one dimensional double array of three elements. [0] = i scaler [1] = j scaler [2] = k scaler. This function does not normalize the vector

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.Transforms.Normalize(System.Double[])
member.summary: Normalizes a one dimensional matrix a
member.returns: a one dimensional double matrix with same number of elements as a

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.Transforms.DotProduct(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculates the dot product of the collection of matricies in this class and returns the 4x4 result.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.Transforms.DotProduct
member.summary: Computes dotproduct of member 4x4 matrices

member.summary: use for any 4x4 transform

member.summary: Use only with LHT transforms

member.summary: Returns the 0,3 element of array or the tp.x

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.A
member.summary:
Returns a two element double array, where:
A[0] = A in terms of 360 axis
A[1] = A in terms of a +/- axis. Calculates the Atp Based on the k vector. Units are degrees.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.rXrYrZFixedAngle
member.summary: rXrYrZFixedAngle returns a double array. In DEGREES. This is NOT the same as the old school ABC.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.rXrYrZ
member.summary: rXrYrz returns a 3 x 2 matrix. Column one is one solution, Column two is the other. Utilize your axis limits to determine the correct solution for this case.. Returns two solutions, both are in degrees. [0,0] is rX solution 1 and [0,1] is rX solution 2

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.rYrXrZ
member.summary: returns values in degrees. both solutions, rx is[0,0] and [0,1] etc

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.rYrXrZbusted
member.summary: returns values in degrees. both solutions, rx is[0,0] and [0,1] etc

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.B
member.summary:
Returns a two element double array, where:
B[0] = B in terms of 360 axis
B[1] = B in terms of a +/- axis. Calculates the Btp Based on the k vector. Units are degrees.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.cMatrix.C
member.summary:
Returns a two element double array, where:
C[0] = C in terms of 360 axis
C[1] = C in terms of a +/- axis. Calculates the Btp Based on the i vector. Units are degrees.

member.summary: return one dimensional 3 element array representing R.

member.summary: Returns the included angle between this vector and RayIn. Absolute value in degrees.

member.summary: returns signed angle in degrees, 2d only. Uses j and k components

member.name: T:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.DHMatrix
member.summary:
The Denavit-Hartenberg Matrix used in all of ToddR's kinematics derivations. Please see Todd's Redbook for more information on this or "Robotic Engineering an Integrated Approach".
Derivation of arguments for the DH matrix must follow the following procedure:
1) Find Theta (rotation about Z)
2) Find d (translate along Z)
3) Find a (translate along X)
4) Find Alpha (rotation about X)

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.DHMatrix.getDH(Electroimpact.StringCalc.cStringCalc)
member.summary: Returns properly formed Denavit - Hartenberg Matrix calculated from Theta, Alpha, a and d which is a 4x4 double array.

member.name: T:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.string6DOF
member.summary:
The Denavit-Hartenberg Matrix used in all of ToddR's kinematics derivations. Please see Todd's Redbook for more information on this or "Robotic Engineering an Integrated Approach".
Derivation of arguments for the DH matrix must follow the following procedure:
1) Find Theta (rotation about Z)
2) Find d (translate along Z)
3) Find a (translate along X)
4) Find Alpha (rotation about X)

member.name: M:Electroimpact.LinearAlgebra.string6DOF.getDH(Electroimpact.StringCalc.cStringCalc)
member.summary: Returns properly formed Denavit - Hartenberg Matrix calculated from Theta, Alpha, a and d which is a 4x4 double array.

member.name: T:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis
member.summary: An axis of a CNC or Robotic Machine and all the stuff I like to use to make it work right.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor requires a Name and to know if this axis is Rotary.
member.param: string Unique Axis name must match setup file

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.Name
member.summary: Defined in constructor, this is read only afterwards.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.ScaleFactor
member.summary:
double value. The axis is position will be multiplied by this number when used in calculations. ScaleFactor = 1.006
base.value returns (this.myPos - Offset) * ScaleFactor

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.Offset
member.summary:
double value. The Offset will be subtracted from the axis position before multiplied by ScaleFactor when used in calculations. Offset = 100.0
base.value returns (this.myPos + Offset) * ScaleFactor

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.Position
member.summary: If this is a rotary axis, the value must be in degrees! This function returns a value in degrees. Use the property "Value" if you want scaled, offsetted position in radians for caliculations.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.Value
member.summary: Used in calculations not for display!!!! myArg = Value where value is base.myPos * base.ScaleFactor - base.Offset

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cAxis.Rotary
member.summary: true causes this axis to behave like a rotary axis. This parameter can only be set in the constructor.

member.name: T:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine
member.summary: An Electroimpact machine.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.cVariableLocation.AssignVariablesToDHs(System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Once the entire machine config file is read, hand this class the VariableNames and the DHs derived from the file. This function will assignblame to the appropriate DHs. Later, when changing a variables value, call MarkVairable to cause the DH to update the appropriate arguments and matrix.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.cVariableLocation.MarkVariable(System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Markes the appropriate DH as needs recalc
member.param: Array list of DH matrix classes for the machine you are working on.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This class requires a setup file. Please see example located somewhere.
member.param: string representing a loc and filename e.g. c:\doggy\doggystyle.config

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.IsHookedUp
member.summary: Indicates if constructor appeared successful.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.A
member.summary: two dimensional array of the A pos. 0 - returns 0 to 360. 1 - returns +/- 180.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.rXrYrZ
member.summary: rXrYrz returns a 3 x 2 matrix. Column one is one solution, Column two is the other. Utilize your axis limits to determine the correct solution for this case. this number is in degrees! annoying!

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.rZrYrX
member.summary: Standard robot notation. Toolpoint rotated about Z then by rotated Y then rotated X

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.B
member.summary: two dimensional array of the B pos. 0 - returns 0 to 360. 1 - returns +/- 180.

member.name: P:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.C
member.summary: two dimensional array of the C pos. 0 - returns 0 to 360. 1 - returns +/- 180.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.WriteAxisPosition(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Modifies the Position. This is the raw unscaled machine position of an axis in this machine. You must call DotProduct for this to take effect! You should modify all axis positions before calling DotProduct.
member.param: double position in either degrees or linear unit

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.WriteAxisAttribute(System.String,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Intended to be used with the solver tool...otherwise these are set during instantiation from the config file.
member.param: one of the axes specified in your config file
one of the attributes allowed: offset, scale1, scale2, scalefactor

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.ReadAxisAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Reads an axis type attribute

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.ReadAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a machine attribute, these are in the static variables section of the config file.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.WriteAttribute(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Writes a machine attribute, these are in the static variables section of the config file.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.GetAxisScaledPosition(System.String)
member.summary: This is the scaled, offset and full fancy comp'd axis position. Use for calculations only!

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.DotProduct
member.summary: Calculates this machine's transform
member.returns: retruns double[4,4] representation of dotproduct with these machine axis values.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.DotProduct(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns a partial solution
member.param: First transfrom to include in the solution (ONE BASED)
Last transform to include in the solution
member.returns: double[4,4] of the requested partial solution
member.example:
cMatrix m = new cMatrix(myMachine.DotProduct(0,1)) or
double[,] dog = myMachine.DotProduct(0,1)

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.ToFile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a configuration file representing the current state of the machine.
member.param: string representing the filename you wish to use

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.GetAttributeNames
member.summary: Gets all static variable names. For use with the solver. During solving, these "static" variables are manipulated to match tracker data.
member.returns: a string array of static variable names

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.GetAxisNames
member.summary: Returns a string array of this machine's axis names.

member.name: M:Electroimpact.Machine.cMachine.GetAxisNames(System.Boolean)
